metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27352 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.Description:
When generating the systemd service units for the docker snap (and othersimilar snaps), snapd does not specify Delegate=yes - as a result systemdwill move processes from the containers created and managed by these snapsinto the cgroup of the main daemon within the snap itself when reloadingsystem units. This may grant additional privileges to a container withinthe snap that were not originally intended.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27352` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.48.3+20.04
snapd - 2.48.3+20.04
snapd-xdg-open - 2.48.3+20.04
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.48.3+20.04
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.48.3+20.04
ubuntu-snappy - 2.48.3+20.04
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.48.3+20.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.48.3+20.04').
